title: 'We are all looking for path to win': Over 20 governors come to Biden's rescue amid calls for stepping down
content: White House Press Secretary Jean-Pierre affirms Biden's dedication to the campaign amid doubts from Democrats about his strategy.
summary: White House Press Secretary Jean-Pierre affirms Biden's dedication to the campaign amid doubts from Democrats about his strategy.

title: Man jailed for carrying 6-inch replica of iconic sword from Nintendo
content: A man in Nuneaton, Warwickshire, Anthony Bray, was sentenced to four months in prison for carrying a 6-inch Master Sword replica from Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series. Despite claiming it was a fidget toy, he was arrested for carrying a bladed article. Bray received a four-month prison sentence and a victims' surcharge of £154.
summary: A man in Nuneaton, Warwickshire, Anthony Bray, was sentenced to four months in prison for carrying a 6-inch Master Sword replica from Nintendo's The Legend of Zelda series. Despite claiming it was a fidget toy, he was arrested for carrying a bladed article. Bray received a four-month prison sentence and a victims' surcharge of £154.

title: 'Second American revolution if...': Right-wing think tank head says they are in the process of 'taking country back'
Hurricane Beryl strikes Jamaica with intense winds and heavy rainfall
content: Hurricane Beryl, a powerful Category 4 storm, swept past Jamaica late on Wednesday, bringing intense winds and heavy rainfall. The storm had previously caused significant damage and claimed at least seven lives in the southeastern Caribbean.
summary: Hurricane Beryl, a powerful Category 4 storm, swept past Jamaica late on Wednesday, bringing intense winds and heavy rainfall. The storm had previously caused significant damage and claimed at least seven lives in the southeastern Caribbean.

title: US President Joe Biden acknowledges 'critical days' to save candidacy
content: US President Joe Biden acknowledges the importance of the coming days for his re-election campaign after a poor debate performance. Despite pressure from allies and donors to step down, he remains determined to stay in the race. Biden plans to reassure voters with upcoming appearances and interviews, amidst internal concerns about his viability and age. A new poll shows Trump leading Biden by 6 points among likely voters.
summary: US President Joe Biden acknowledges the importance of the coming days for his re-election campaign after a poor debate performance. Despite pressure from allies and donors to step down, he remains determined to stay in the race. Biden plans to reassure voters with upcoming appearances and interviews, amidst internal concerns about his viability and age. A new poll shows Trump leading Biden by 6 points among likely voters.

title: Why Muslims are wary of Far-Right win in French polls
content: Marine Le Pen's RN came out well ahead in Sunday's first-round vote after President Emmanuel Macron's gamble on a snap election backfired, leaving his centrist camp in a lowly third place behind the RN and a hastily formed left-wing alliance. Pollsters calculated the first round put the RN on track for anything between 250-300 seats. But that was before the tactical withdrawals and cross-party calls for voters to back whichever candidate was best placed to defeat the local RN rival.
summary: Marine Le Pen's RN came out well ahead in Sunday's first-round vote after President Emmanuel Macron's gamble on a snap election backfired, leaving his centrist camp in a lowly third place behind the RN and a hastily formed left-wing alliance. Pollsters calculated the first round put the RN on track for anything between 250-300 seats. But that was before the tactical withdrawals and cross-party calls for voters to back whichever candidate was best placed to defeat the local RN rival.

title: Hamas says it has sent new 'ideas' on halting Israel war
'If Biden is awake': White House briefing turns into debate on President's cold, nap time. Watch
content: "Have you ever got a cold," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre asked a correspondent Wednesday during the White House briefing on a question over how President was wobbly during the debate for which his cold was blamed and was fit the next day at the campaign. White House said they did not reveal the information about the cold ahead of the debate as they did not want to use it.
summary: "Have you ever got a cold," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre asked a correspondent Wednesday during the White House briefing on a question over how President was wobbly during the debate for which his cold was blamed and was fit the next day at the campaign. White House said they did not reveal the information about the cold ahead of the debate as they did not want to use it.

title: Biden, Kamala Harris' joint rare appearance, pep talk amid doubt over ticket
content: ​Biden convened the meeting with Kamala Harris and a group of influential Democratic governors amid speculations that he may announce his decision to drop out of the re-election bid. But the meeting was like a pep talk confirming that Kamala Harris was not going to take Biden's place and Biden was not mulling to opt out either.
summary: ​Biden convened the meeting with Kamala Harris and a group of influential Democratic governors amid speculations that he may announce his decision to drop out of the re-election bid. But the meeting was like a pep talk confirming that Kamala Harris was not going to take Biden's place and Biden was not mulling to opt out either.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy has this advice for Democrats on 'which puppet to choose'
content: ​Vivek Ramaswamy, who is being seen as the Republican's VP candidate, offered a piece of advice with a banter to the Democrats as speculations are rife over Biden alternatives. The Indian-American billionaire said the more the Democrats delay choosing their 'puppet', it's best for them -- contrary to the popular belief as there will be a honeymoon period after a new candidate is picked. The Democrats' ideal situation would be the election to be held during that honeymoon period sans public scrutiny, Vivek Ramaswamy said.
summary: ​Vivek Ramaswamy, who is being seen as the Republican's VP candidate, offered a piece of advice with a banter to the Democrats as speculations are rife over Biden alternatives. The Indian-American billionaire said the more the Democrats delay choosing their 'puppet', it's best for them -- contrary to the popular belief as there will be a honeymoon period after a new candidate is picked. The Democrats' ideal situation would be the election to be held during that honeymoon period sans public scrutiny, Vivek Ramaswamy said.

title: Biden told ally he may not be able to salvage candidacy: Report
content: ​President Joe Biden, despite the top Democrats now putting up a brave face publicly following the debate debacle, knows that he may not be able to salvage his candidacy if he cannot convince the public in the coming days he knows how to do the job. And he has told this to a key ally, New York Times reported. The report claimed that White House spokesperson Andrew Bates dismissed the report of Biden mulling to withdraw from the race and said it was "absolutely false".
summary: ​President Joe Biden, despite the top Democrats now putting up a brave face publicly following the debate debacle, knows that he may not be able to salvage his candidacy if he cannot convince the public in the coming days he knows how to do the job. And he has told this to a key ally, New York Times reported. The report claimed that White House spokesperson Andrew Bates dismissed the report of Biden mulling to withdraw from the race and said it was "absolutely false".

title: 'Before marrying Melania in 2005': What new documents claim about Trump-Epstein
content: ​New documents which were unreleased so far claim that Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein were closer than it was believed. Transcripts show Trump called Epstein many times between 2004 and 2006. The screenshots were sealed in 2008 as part of Alexander Acosta's deal for Jeffrey Epstein and were released on July 1.
summary: ​New documents which were unreleased so far claim that Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein were closer than it was believed. Transcripts show Trump called Epstein many times between 2004 and 2006. The screenshots were sealed in 2008 as part of Alexander Acosta's deal for Jeffrey Epstein and were released on July 1.

title: Polls show Michelle Obama leading Donald Trump, sparking Democratic speculation amid Joe Biden concerns
content: In a surprising turn, Michelle Obama emerges as a formidable contender against Donald Trump, leading by a significant margin in recent polls. Key Democratic figures express concerns about Joe Biden's performance, prompting calls for urgent action to evaluate his candidacy. Other potential candidates show weaker polling numbers against Trump, highlighting Obama's strength in the political landscape.
summary: In a surprising turn, Michelle Obama emerges as a formidable contender against Donald Trump, leading by a significant margin in recent polls. Key Democratic figures express concerns about Joe Biden's performance, prompting calls for urgent action to evaluate his candidacy. Other potential candidates show weaker polling numbers against Trump, highlighting Obama's strength in the political landscape.

title: In a first, Canada appoints woman as army chief
Meet UK's Hindu Conservative candidate Reva Gudi who is inspired by Bhagavad Gita
content: Dr Reva Gudi, fighting from Feltham and Heston, is inspired by Bhagavad Gita's message of detachment, she said. The Hindu candidate said Gita's messages helped her navigate in the male-dominated world of politics which she entered after a long career as an NHS GP for over 20 years. "As a Hindu woman, I do sometimes face unique challenges, including overcoming stereotypes and ensuring that my voice is heard, in predominantly, what can be a male-dominated field," she said.
summary: Dr Reva Gudi, fighting from Feltham and Heston, is inspired by Bhagavad Gita's message of detachment, she said. The Hindu candidate said Gita's messages helped her navigate in the male-dominated world of politics which she entered after a long career as an NHS GP for over 20 years. "As a Hindu woman, I do sometimes face unique challenges, including overcoming stereotypes and ensuring that my voice is heard, in predominantly, what can be a male-dominated field," she said.

title: Ivanka Trump says politics is pretty dark world but...
content: Melania Trump will not be a 24X7 First Lady if Donald Trump returns to the White House as she would like to spend her time with Barron Trump in New York. Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump too was not seen much publicly in her father's campaigning but she said she would attend the Republican National Convention where her father would officially accept the presidential nomination from the party.
summary: Melania Trump will not be a 24X7 First Lady if Donald Trump returns to the White House as she would like to spend her time with Barron Trump in New York. Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka Trump too was not seen much publicly in her father's campaigning but she said she would attend the Republican National Convention where her father would officially accept the presidential nomination from the party.

title: UK election: What are Labour's foreign policy plans?
Spoilt food forces Delta flight to make emergency landing
content: A Delta Airlines flight with 277 passengers on board made an emergency landing in New York in the early hours Wednesday after it was found out that the fliers were served with contaminated food. The airlines regretted the incident and promised an investigation while fliers had to bear the brunt of the delay.
summary: A Delta Airlines flight with 277 passengers on board made an emergency landing in New York in the early hours Wednesday after it was found out that the fliers were served with contaminated food. The airlines regretted the incident and promised an investigation while fliers had to bear the brunt of the delay.

title: UN rights chief warns about rise of far-right in Europe
content: United Nations rights chief Volker Turk, driven by Austria's anti-semitic history, advocates for refugee protection and condemns hate speech in Europe. His stance highlights the critical role of political leaders in promoting tolerance and preventing discriminatory behavior.
summary: United Nations rights chief Volker Turk, driven by Austria's anti-semitic history, advocates for refugee protection and condemns hate speech in Europe. His stance highlights the critical role of political leaders in promoting tolerance and preventing discriminatory behavior.

title: 'Garbage': RFK Jr says he ate goat in viral photo, not barbequed dog
content: A major row erupted after an old photo of Robert F Kennedy Jr with a carcass of a four-footed animal surfaced. According to claims, Kennedy Jr was going to take a bite into the barbequed dog in the viral photo. But the 70-year-old presidential candidate rubbished the claim and said it was a goat and the photo was taken in 2010 in Patagonia, not Korea.
summary: A major row erupted after an old photo of Robert F Kennedy Jr with a carcass of a four-footed animal surfaced. According to claims, Kennedy Jr was going to take a bite into the barbequed dog in the viral photo. But the 70-year-old presidential candidate rubbished the claim and said it was a goat and the photo was taken in 2010 in Patagonia, not Korea.
